item.title: Image of 50 Million Yr Old Organic Compounds - 3/23/11
item.description: Stories about a microscope lens that creates a 3-D image from nine different angles simultaneously, the first infrared image of the organic compounds surviving in 50-million-year-old fossilized reptile skin, a billion-times-more-sensitive Raman sensor that relies on a completely new architecture and fabrication technique, and the ability to control the way light is scattered in graphene are presented by Photonics Media's Melinda Rose and Laura Marshall in the March 23 edition of Light Matters.

item.title: Light Matters - 3/16/11
item.description: The impact of Japan's historic earthquake on optics makers, a preview of the March issue of BioPhotonics magazine, the real-time observation of how electrons swarm under the influence of strong laser pulses and how they behave in the laser's slipstream, and NASA's Robonaut 2 are all discussed in this week's edition of Light Matters, hosted by Photonics Media's Melinda Rose and Laura Marshall.

item.title: Light Matters - 3/9/11
item.description: Weekly Photonics News Roundup - A new microscope that illuminates cells using a thin sheet of light, a laser tool that sutures wounds, the first reported reversal of the optical Doppler effect and a new iPad app for optical tweezers are covered in this edition of Light Matters, Photonics Media’s weekly newscast. Hosted by Photonics.com Senior Editor Melinda Rose.
